title: Unterminated string error message points at the wrong line

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code: 
https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=2e32fcf710139d444b28553c200dd8e7
```rust
fn main() {
hello("world);
// a bunch of code was here
env("FLAGS", "-help")
}
```


The current output is:

```
error[E0765]: unterminated double quote string
 --> bug.rs:4:20
  |
4 |   env("FLAGS", "-help")
  |  ____________________^
5 | | }
  | |__^
```

Ideally the output should look like:

```
error[E0765]: unterminated double quote string
 --> bug.rs:2:7
  |
2 |   hello("world);
  |  _______^
3 | | // a bunch of code was here
4 | | env("FLAGS", "-help")
5 | | }
  | |__^
```

The error message points at line 4, but the mistake is on line 2. I encountered this issue in a Rust program that has 215 lines. The compiler was pointing at line 208, but the unterminated string was on line 180.

Both rustc 1.56.1 and rustc 1.62.0-nightly (a5ad0d29a 2022-05-12) are affected by this issue.
